reviews.review_msg: His class can be somewhat boring because of the books we read, but it's an interesting course considering everyone gets to express how they feel about each book. David is always very supportive of the answers also. He will never make you feel uncomfortable or unwanted.

Lectures are not interesting, course material is poorly chosen, and you have no contact with her unless you're in a tutorial that is lead by her. This class has discouraged me from further pursuing english.
Pros: Clear about what expectations and assignments. Very helpful if you pay attention. Good lecturer; keeps you interested. Cons: None.

I stopped attending her lectures after the first few classes, her accent was hard to listen and the microphone was terrible. What she explained was a bit confusing too. But overall, the course is easy.

Theories brought up in lecture were interesting but hard to wrap your head around. A lot of "deep" analysis involved. A picky marker -- she finds flaws in essays and magnifies them so that the whole essay has to be changed for the problems to be fixed. Some people do enjoy her way of thinking, but I wouldn't take this class again.

Hated the course content. However, Susan seemed passionate about the subject. I did not like how in depth she analyzed the novels that we read. DO NOT take this course if you don't like to read, we read 4 novels. You will succeed if you write "deep" analytical essays.

Her lectures are organized and she's easy to understand. Repeats important things to make sure its clear to students which is helpful. However lectures are useless because they want you to develop your own ideas for papers and assignments. Grade depends on the TA you get. Attend tutorial its extremely helpful and interesting if you participate.
Worst prof ever wouldnt take again
Hard marker, unclear and instructions and slow to return assignments which feedback was needed for the proceeding assignment
Just AVOID her.....

Way too strict and expectations are way too high for a 100 level English course. Not to be rude or anything, but the whole "what is the significance, what are the implications" is going way over. The books are boring in the first place, and setting the bar that high is just tormenting the students. The TAs were not helpful in terms of assignments.

She is the worst teacher ever. She does not know how to teach. Her lectures are very boring and she marks very hard. Do no take her class if you want a good mark in English. Everyone I know hates her too.
shes nice, and marks fairly. I found lectures quite boring, and I dont think they attendance is necessary in order to do well
Tells you exactly what topics you should cover on the exams and very engaging with students in lecture. Very nice lady.

I'm sure if you took a first nations studies class with her it would be fine, but english is definitely not her priority. I think I learned more in grade 10 than I have this entire year. Her lectures are horribly boring and you read the absolute worst books...if you want english take it with another prof

She was very repetitive. As an introduction to fiction course, we talked only about Natives. The novels weren't very interesting and the TA's marked very difficult and didn't ever explain exactly what they wanted. The Prof says umm every other word and shows the same ppt slides in multiple lectures.
TAs marking is unfair, novels are ridiculously hard to understand since it is about native stories

extremely bad prof..dont bother taking her class. like other student said, it is a native course, not english. she talks too much and is really boring, people just leave her class halfway because no one can stand her.

I signed up for an intro to fiction english course. turns out since the prof is part of the first nations department all we're freakin learning is NATIVE BOOKS. 5 native books, its okay if u choose 1 or 2 but wow FIVE!! in lecture we learn about what kind of fruits natives eat and native reserves, NOT ENGLISH!boring not recommended,she cant speak.
she is not helpful, class super boring. students only attend because of iclicker. talks nonsense. just dont talk class with her..BORING! says UM a million times.

Carolyn is great! She makes lectures fun with her goofy sense of humour, and is very passionate about English. She is not overly strict, and definitely supports free thinking! Class expectations were clear and marking was very fair. I just really enjoyed every lecture with Carolyn, and would definitely recommend her!
Best English class I have ever taken. Every lecture seemed to actually have a purpose. She made her ideas and expectations fairly clear throughout the entire class .Interesting and thought provoking.
It was really a pleasure to take his class. He will give detailed feedback to each person in a sincere and friendly manner.

Teds class was a very nice break from the chaos that was my last semester. His lectures are unique (at least in FIC), and listening to him is pure pleasure. Every week he hands out questions which can help you prepare for the exams and goes through them in detail. My advice is to actively participate, and you should be fine. Thank you, Ted!
Great prof and an even better person. Tough marker but he is very specific about what he wants from you. So follow what he says, participate in class and you'll do fine.

Wouldn't recommend skipping lectures - no notes uploaded, lecture recording, or really anything supplementary sent out. Lectures can seem dull at times, but you gain a better understanding of the books and it will REALLY help your marks. Lots of reading so skimming the books might be more practical.

Lectures felt very long for 50 minutes. Says 'um' all the time. Midterm was worth 2.5% and asked ridiculous questions. Two essays that don't generalise to other academic writing: a close reading of a paragraph and a compare-contrast paper, which might eventually be useful, but not when everything else is research essays. Wouldn't take her again.

Midterm was worth 5% & was such a waste of time. Reading and essays were fair. Essays marked pretty hard though, get your thesis and argument approved by TA and you'll likely do better on the essay. Sophie was cute, lectures weren't that bad although she was just talking about what we read. I would take a class with her again.

Lectures are extremely boring and useless, she basically summarizes the stories you read. She cannot explain herself concisely so it's hard to understand what she's trying to say when it takes her 20 sentences to get it out. She seems helpful and kind, but it's always uncomfortable one on one. I wouldn't take a class with her again.

Lectures are extremely useless and boring. Over 30 short stories to read in the class, and her midterm required you to remember extremely minor, unimportant details. She mostly talks about her own opinions of the stories during lectures; she's kind in person but can be intimidating one-on-one. Not helpful when it comes to teaching.

Papers are marked pretty hard. Sophie was nice though, she was cute and had good ideas about the readings. Stay on top of the readings and participate in tutorials lots. Midterm was only worth 5% Final was worth more though but not too bad. The amount of work was fair. Lectures were a bit boring.

Easiest class I ever took at SFU. Sophie's literature choices are not always the most interesting. Readings are required, but posts lecture notes online so attendance is only required if you want participation credit for in-class activities. Essay questions posted ahead of time and all multiple choice are from the textbook website

Sophie is a very kind prof with interesting ideas. She sheds new light on many pieces of literature. Sometimes it's difficult to understand what she's looking for, but once understood, assignments are easy (and scarce!). Good class.
